post_text:
Donna ISD is proud to kick off our new ‚ÄúMeals on Wheels‚Äù program. A big thank you to our Child Nutrition and Transportation staff for preparing and delivering healthy meals to students in rural neighborhoods. On this day, Superintendent Azaiez used this opportunity to ride along with staff and visit with students and parents in an effort to gain more insight on how the district can help them during this pandemic. We would also like to thank the media for publicizing our program.
Channel 5: https://bit.ly/3hvw7n7
Channel 4: https://bit.ly/2RrXOCH
Telemundo: https://bit.ly/2E7cLXK

post_text: We invite you to like and follow our new FB page DISD Early College High School.
shared_text:
DISD Early College High School
August 3 at 9:08 PM ¬∑

As we continue to battle through the many uncertainties caused by Covid-19, one thing remains certain: we are eager to work with our students!
We have created a great partnership with South Texas College, and together, we are committed to reducing college barriers by providing our students the unique opportunity to simultaneously earn a high school diploma and a 2-year Associate Degree at no cost to students or parents.
We look forward to welcoming our students soon! In the meantime, please continue to follow DISD's social media sites and accept automated phone messages from the district and/or campus for the latest school news.
Stay safe.üò∑
text:
We invite you to like and follow our new FB page DISD Early College High School.

DISD Early College High School
August 3 at 9:08 PM ¬∑

As we continue to battle through the many uncertainties caused by Covid-19, one thing remains certain: we are eager to work with our students!
We have created a great partnership with South Texas College, and together, we are committed to reducing college barriers by providing our students the unique opportunity to simultaneously earn a high school diploma and a 2-year Associate Degree at no cost to students or parents.
We look forward to welcoming our students soon! In the meantime, please continue to follow DISD's social media sites and accept automated phone messages from the district and/or campus for the latest school news.
Stay safe.üò∑

Hidalgo County
July 25 at 7:35 PM ¬∑

SHELTERS OPEN IN HIDALGO COUNTY
üîªUpdated as of 7:30pm on Saturday, July 25üîª

üîπPalm Aire Hotel - 415 S. International Blvd., Weslaco
üîπMcAllen Respite Center - 111 S. 15th St., McAllen
üîπThe Salvation Army - 1600 N. 23rd St., McAllen
üîπLa Joya Youth Center Gym - 604 Salomon Chapa Drive, La Joya
üîπPharr Development Research Center - 850 W. Dicker Road, Pharr (Pharr residents only)
‚Ä¨üîπChac√≥n Middle School (for non-COVID residents) - 801 S. Mile 1 East‚Ä¨, Mercedes
üîπMercedes Dome(for COVID exposed families) - 1202 N. Vermont, Mercedes

üî¥Due to COVID-19, masks will be mandatory inside the sheltersüî¥

Residents should also bring other PPE such as gloves and hand sanitizer to maintain proper hygiene. While inside the shelter, social distancing must be maintained as much as possible.

Residents should also bring water, snacks, blankets, medication and any important documents.

As we continue to monitor the storm, the list of shelters may be updated periodically. Please follow us on social media, for the latest information on Hurricane Hanna.

post_text:
Dear Parents and Students,

In light of the recent surge of COVID-19 cases in Hidalgo County, Donna ISD has made the difficult decision to cancel its in-person graduation ceremonies scheduled for next week. As you may be aware, county leaders have been issuing daily reports of triple-digit numbers of positive cases over the past several days prompting concerns. While it is with heavy hearts that we make this decision, we felt it was a necessary action to take to ensure the safety and security of our DISD students, staff, and community.

Previously, we had offered alternative dates in July and August as options, however, as we closely monitor the rising trends of the virus, the situation does not look as if it is getting any better. Therefore, the district reached the decision to cancel commencement in the best interest of our DISD community.

We thank you for your patience and understanding and most importantly, we want to wish our graduates the very best in your future endeavors as you begin the next chapter in your lives.

Stay safe.
text:
Dear Parents and Students,

In light of the recent surge of COVID-19 cases in Hidalgo County, Donna ISD has made the difficult decision to cancel its in-person graduation ceremonies scheduled for next week. As you may be aware, county leaders have been issuing daily reports of triple-digit numbers of positive cases over the past several days prompting concerns. While it is with heavy hearts that we make this decision, we felt it was a necessary action to take to ensure the safety and security of our DISD students, staff, and community.

Previously, we had offered alternative dates in July and August as options, however, as we closely monitor the rising trends of the virus, the situation does not look as if it is getting any better. Therefore, the district reached the decision to cancel commencement in the best interest of our DISD community.

We thank you for your patience and understanding and most importantly, we want to wish our graduates the very best in your future endeavors as you begin the next chapter in your lives.

Stay safe.

post_text: Donna ISD‚Äôs Police Dept. held a memorial service this afternoon for K-9 Officer Honz who was euthanized June 12th due to old age and chronic conditions.K-9 Honz had been part of the Donna ISD Police Dept. since 2013 where he served as the police department‚Äôs first Pet Therapy dog. His partner, Corporal Robert Rodriguez said he had brought joy and happiness to many of our students and staff over the years and was the department‚Äôs most requested K-9 by our staff. Prior to his work with our police department, K-9 Honz served as a Military Search and Rescue K-9 in Afghanistan. K-9 Honz was 13 years old. The PD would like to send a special thank you to Hawkins Funeral home for donating the American flag and HEB in Weslaco for the flower donation.

shared_text:
DISD Donna High School
June 8 at 5:20 PM ¬∑

The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department would like to congratulate Donna High School student, Vicente Lopez, for earning the title of Certified Clinical Medical Assistant (CCMA). Vicente has completed a rigorous Health Science pathway, CCMA course, and worked hard to prepare for the challenging 150+ question NHA exam required to earn this certification. Medical Assistants fulfill both clinical and administrative tasks at hospitals, physician's offices, and many other medical settings. Vicente is off to a great start on his journey into the healthcare industry. The Donna ISD community is very proud of Vicente.

Congratulations also goes out to our amazing DHS Health Science instructor, Mrs. Martha Caceres COTA, for providing these great learning opportunities for our students.

David Q. Moreno
Career & Technical Education Director
Donna I.S.D.

post_text: Congratulations!
shared_text:
DISD Donna High School
June 8 at 5:58 PM ¬∑

Donna High School is proud to announce that the following four students: Brayan Cisneros, Rigoberto Jimenez, Chloe Villarreal, and Savannah Villarreal just passed the (CET) national exam that licenses them as certified EKG Technicians!

The need for qualified EKG technicians continues to rise as the overall health concerns among people of all ages in America grows (and with that, the prevalence of heart-related conditions). Earning their EKG certification will help our students launch a successful and meaningful healthcare career that can help make a difference in countless lives. The future is certainly bright for our students.

Mario Medrano RT
Donna High School
EKG Instructor
HOSA Advisor

post_text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT
text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT

post_text:
Donna ISD's Special Education Department would like to recognize our awesome speech team during National Speech Pathologist Day.

Speech Language Pathologists:
Diana Morrison
Sandra Panola- Lopez
Vanessa Elizondo Herrera
Evelyn Cardenas
Vanessa Mercado

Speech Language Pathologist Assistants:
Veronica Castillo
Christina Reyes
Jacqueline Alvarez
Erica Cereceres
Sandra Rodriguez

Thank you ladies for your dedication and services to our students. Your contribution to the language and speech development of our students speaks volumes of your passion and knowledge. Many may take for granted their communication and speech ability while many of our students strive daily to meet their speech goals with much joy and sense of accomplishment thanks to you.

You help give our students voice and confidence through your guidance and care. Thank you for the amazing work you do for students!

shared_text:
KRGV.COM
UTRGV medical school graduates share educational journey
text:
Donna alums and now new doctors Daniella Concha and Cristina Cepeda were featured on Channel 5 News. The 2010 Donna High graduates credit Donna ISD for preparing them to become doctors. https://www.krgv.com/news/utrgv-medical-school-graduates-share-educational-journey

KRGV.COM
UTRGV medical school graduates share educational journey

post_text: Congratulations to Donna High 2010 graduates Daniella Concha and Cristina Cepeda. They are now doctors. Both ladies were among the first cohort of 39 to graduate from UTRGV School of Medicine. Only 6 Valley school districts were represented and Donna ISD was the only one who had 2 alums. You have made Donna ISD proud. Daniella will continue her studies at New York Presbyterian ‚Äì Columbia University Medical Center with a concentration in Internal Medicine. Cristina will continue her studies in Family & Community Medicine at the University of Texas Health Science Center in San Antonio.
text: Congratulations to Donna High 2010 graduates Daniella Concha and Cristina Cepeda. They are now doctors. Both ladies were among the first cohort of 39 to graduate from UTRGV School of Medicine. Only 6 Valley school districts were represented and Donna ISD was the only one who had 2 alums. You have made Donna ISD proud. Daniella will continue her studies at New York Presbyterian ‚Äì Columbia University Medical Center with a concentration in Internal Medicine. Cristina will continue her studies in Family & Community Medicine at the University of Texas Health Science Center in San Antonio.

shared_text:
DISD Donna North High School
May 7 at 5:13 PM ¬∑

The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department is proud to announce that DNHS student, Michael Leon, has earned his Class A (truck driving) Commercial Driver's License (CDL). The Donna ISD community is very proud of Michael as he begins entry into a career where the demand for truck drivers is high. Now, more than ever, we see the importance of truck drivers as they play a critical part in delivering essential goods throughout the country. The CTE Department and the Donna ISD community would like to wish Michael Leon the best of luck in his future career endeavours.

A big thank you goes out to Mr. Aldo Ortiz, RGV CDL owner, and Mr. Lupe Quintero, RGV CDL instructor, for partnering up with Donna ISD and providing these great career opportunities for our students.

Thank you also goes out to Dr. Hafedh Azaiez, Donna ISD Superintendent of Schools, and our Board of Trustees for their continued support of our CTE programs.
text:
DISD Donna North High School
May 7 at 5:13 PM ¬∑

The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department is proud to announce that DNHS student, Michael Leon, has earned his Class A (truck driving) Commercial Driver's License (CDL). The Donna ISD community is very proud of Michael as he begins entry into a career where the demand for truck drivers is high. Now, more than ever, we see the importance of truck drivers as they play a critical part in delivering essential goods throughout the country. The CTE Department and the Donna ISD community would like to wish Michael Leon the best of luck in his future career endeavours.

A big thank you goes out to Mr. Aldo Ortiz, RGV CDL owner, and Mr. Lupe Quintero, RGV CDL instructor, for partnering up with Donna ISD and providing these great career opportunities for our students.

Thank you also goes out to Dr. Hafedh Azaiez, Donna ISD Superintendent of Schools, and our Board of Trustees for their continued support of our CTE programs.

post_text: Teacher Appreciation Week is May 4-8 and now more than ever our Donna ISD teachers deserve our respect and admiration. When the COVID-19 crisis hit and our schools were forced to close, our teachers had to immediately change their entire lesson plans from working in the classroom to working through distance learning overnight. Although they faced many obstacles, they found ways to adapt to make sure our students continued to learn from home. This week, we salute you and thank you for the amazing job you‚Äôre doing. Check out our first of 5 videos that we will be posting throughout the week.

Although they faced many obstacles, they found ways to adapt to make sure our students continued to learn from home. This week, we salute you and thank you for the amazing job you‚Äôre doing. shared_text:
DISD Donna North High School
April 27 at 12:45 PM ¬∑

On Friday, April 24, 2020, Donna North T-STEM High School sent out the acceptance letters to prospective Sauceda Middle School and Veterans Middle School students who submitted their T-STEM applications after the Donna North T-STEM recruitment visits that took place in late February.

Donna North T-STEM High School offers students the opportunity to focus on STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) careers, as well as take dual enrollment courses that allow them to earn college hours as soon as the spring semester of their 9th grade year and having the opportunity to graduate with their associate‚Äôs degree upon graduation. Students attending Donna North High T-STEM High School also have the opportunity to take part in all the extra-curricular activities (athletics, band, choir, dance, theater arts, and all the clubs and organizations) that Donna North High School has to offer.

Donna North T-STEM has LIMITED spots available for next year‚Äôs freshman class. Any interested parents/students can send an email to: donnanorth.tstem@donnaisd.net for more information.

Donna North T-STEM High School offers students the opportunity to focus on STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) careers, as well as take dual enrollment courses that allow them to earn college hours as soon as the spring semester of their 9th grade year and having the opportunity to graduate with their associate‚Äôs degree upon graduation. Students attending Donna North High T-STEM High School also have the opportunity to take part in all the extra-curricular activities (athletics, band, choir, dance, theater arts, and all the clubs and organizations) that Donna North High School has to offer.

Donna North T-STEM has LIMITED spots available for next year‚Äôs freshman class. Any interested parents/students can send an email to: donnanorth.tstem@donnaisd.net for more information.

post_text:
The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department is proud to announce that DHS students, Jose Cruz Faz and Robert Tamez, have earned their Class A (truck driving) Commercial Driver's License (CDL). The Donna ISD community is very proud of Jose and Robert as they begin entry into a career where the demand for truck drivers is high. Now, more than ever, we see the importance of truck drivers as essential workers as they play a critical part in delivering essential goods throughout the country. The CTE Department and the Donna ISD community would like to wish Jose and Robert the best of luck in their future career endeavours.

A big thank you goes out to Mr. Aldo Ortiz, RGV CDL owner, and Mr. Lupe Quintero, RGV CDL instructor, for partnering up with Donna ISD and providing these great career opportunities for our students.

Thank you also goes out to Dr. Hafedh Azaiez, Donna ISD Superintendent of Schools, and our Board of Trustees for their continued support of our CTE programs.
text:
The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department is proud to announce that DHS students, Jose Cruz Faz and Robert Tamez, have earned their Class A (truck driving) Commercial Driver's License (CDL). The Donna ISD community is very proud of Jose and Robert as they begin entry into a career where the demand for truck drivers is high. Now, more than ever, we see the importance of truck drivers as essential workers as they play a critical part in delivering essential goods throughout the country. The CTE Department and the Donna ISD community would like to wish Jose and Robert the best of luck in their future career endeavours.

A big thank you goes out to Mr. Aldo Ortiz, RGV CDL owner, and Mr. Lupe Quintero, RGV CDL instructor, for partnering up with Donna ISD and providing these great career opportunities for our students.

Thank you also goes out to Dr. Hafedh Azaiez, Donna ISD Superintendent of Schools, and our Board of Trustees for their continued support of our CTE programs.

post_text:
The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department would like to send a shout out to our DNHS students enrolled in the Phlebotomy program for having passed their nationally recognized Phlebotomy Certification Exam. These students tested before Spring Break and have earned the title of Certified Phlebotomy Technician (CPT). Phlebotomy Technicians are critical team members at numerous healthcare facilities and we wish our students well as they have taken a giant step toward embarking on a rewarding healthcare career. Congratulations goes out to the following students:

Back Row and Left to Right
Jaqueline Herrera
Tatiana Basaldua
Bianca Aguirre
Maria Pena

Middle Row and Left to Right
Victoria Cruz
Ruby Cruz
Melva Alonzo

Front Row and Left to Right
Damaris Pacheco
Victor Loredo
Valeria Contreras

A big shout out also goes out to our outstanding DNHS Health Science Instructor, Ms. Lucero Gonzalez RN-BSN, for having a perfect 100% exam passing rate for our students. Thank you for providing these great learning and career opportunities for our students.

post_text:
We would like to thank our DISD community for participating in Census Day April 1st and completing the Census. We are proud to report that the city of Donna saw a significant increase in participation.

We ask that you please encourage friends and family who have not filled out the Census, to do so today. It only takes a few minutes, but the impact will be felt for years. The questionnaire can be completed online, by phone, or by mail. Don't miss out on your chance to make a difference.
text:
We would like to thank our DISD community for participating in Census Day April 1st and completing the Census. We are proud to report that the city of Donna saw a significant increase in participation.

We ask that you please encourage friends and family who have not filled out the Census, to do so today. It only takes a few minutes, but the impact will be felt for years. The questionnaire can be completed online, by phone, or by mail. Don't miss out on your chance to make a difference.

For the safety of our community, we must all make an effort to comply with social distancing in an effort to slowdown and prevent the spread of COVID-19. As a result, DISD‚Äôs Child Nutrition staff are setting up tables outside the grab-and-go meal locations to avoid close contact. Parents are being asked to get off of their vehicles and get their child‚Äôs meals from the tables. Please help support our staff as they are doing their best to abide by the social distancing rule and continue providing meals for our students.

post_text:
A message from Donna Early College High School:

Dear Parents of 8th Grade Students,

It is my hope that you and your loves ones are safe and well. I want to inform you that due to the Covid-19 disease and the inability to return to our schools, the student application deadline has been extended. If you did not get an opportunity to attend a parent meeting and have any questions regarding Donna Early College High School, please call Mrs. Medrano at (956) 332-2423, Monday-Friday, between 9a.m.-1p.m. or send an email to dmedrano@donnaisd.net. The application can be filled out via telephone! If there is no answer, please leave a voicemail with your name and number, and your call will be returned promptly.

Thank you; stay safe.
text:

I want to inform you that due to the Covid-19 disease and the inability to return to our schools, the student application deadline has been extended. If you did not get an opportunity to attend a parent meeting and have any questions regarding Donna Early College High School, please call Mrs. Medrano at (956) 332-2423, Monday-Friday, between 9a.m.-1p.m. or send an email to dmedrano@donnaisd.net. The application can be filled out via telephone! If there is no answer, please leave a voicemail with your name and number, and your call will be returned promptly.

Thank you; stay safe.

post_text: In recognition of Occupational Therapy Month, Donna ISD would like to acknowledge our awesome team for their amazing work. You are a part of a vitally important profession that helps students develop skills needed across their lifespan to participate in things they want to do and in things they need to do through the therapeutic use of everyday activities. Many times, we take for granted the multiple functions and resources that are in our capability - while for many of our students- it is a daily challenge. Thank you Mrs. Robles and Mrs. Rodriguez for always assisting, guiding and encouraging our students with your demonstrated passion, knowledge and drive. Keep up the amazing work.

post_text: April 1st is National Census Day. You can and absolutely should fill out the Census before and after April 1st, but the Census Bureau uses the day as a reference point for the process.Everyone should fill out the Census with the place they will be living in on April 1st, and all children born before or on April 1st should also be counted.For college students who have gone home from school due to COVID-19, they should be counted where they would have been living on April 1st if the outbreak hadn‚Äôt occurred.
text: April 1st is National Census Day. You can and absolutely should fill out the Census before and after April 1st, but the Census Bureau uses the day as a reference point for the process.Everyone should fill out the Census with the place they will be living in on April 1st, and all children born before or on April 1st should also be counted.For college students who have gone home from school due to COVID-19, they should be counted where they would have been living on April 1st if the outbreak hadn‚Äôt occurred.

post_text:
Tomorrow, March 27, from 3 to 5 EST, Scholastic is hosting a free Virtual Book Festival.

Scholastic Home Base Virtual Book Fest is an online celebration where Authors and kids can engage with each other in exciting new ways!

From themed costume contests to online Q&As to trivia events, kids around the world can enjoy interacting with their favorite authors in real-time.

The scheduled Authors for tomorrow include Lauren Tarshis, Christina Soontornvat, Tracey West and Aida Salazar.

Families and students can register at the link below:

https://kids.scholastic.com/kids/games/homebase/bookfest/

post_text: Donna ISD‚Äôs Board of Trustees along with Superintendent Dr. Hafedh Azaiez held an Emergency Video Conference Board meeting at noon today where they unanimously approved a resolution to continue to pay all district employees for their regular work schedule without any interruption throughout this crisis. Hourly employees who are asked to report to work will get paid time and a half. Thank you to our board and superintendent for keeping our employee‚Äôs best interest in mind.

post_text: Coach Marco M. Mthembu from Texas College visited with several of our senior soccer student-athletes today. Coach Mthembu explained to the senior athletes the importance of grade point average, scholarships, and taking the ACT and SAT exams. He also went over eligibility requirements both academically and athletically and what to expect when applying to Texas College and the many opportunities available to them if they attend.

post_text: Our Superintendent, Dr. Azaiez, is the one who goes before the school board once a month to highlight the many successes our students and staff experience. Last night, it was his turn to sit back and be highlighted for the many milestones he has accomplished since becoming our superintendent. It's because of these initiatives that he was chosen as a recipient of the 2020 Distinguished Educator of the Year award by Sam Houston State University, where he earned his Doctorate in Educational Leadership. Hear what some of his colleagues and Donna ISD community had to say.

shared_text:
DISD Donna High School
March 9 at 1:18 PM ¬∑

Donna High School's Mexican American Studies Club attended the annual National Association of Chicano Chicana Scholars Tejas Foco Conference held at South Texas College's Pecan Campus this past Friday and Saturday. The students were given the privilege of kicking off Friday morning's plenary with a presentation on the positive impact Ethnic Studies has on student achievement. The students also gave a presentation on the creation of the border and how it has evolved over time, as well as the realities of daily life on the border as opposed to today's rhetoric. The final group of students presented their oral histories in which they explained to the audience how conducting these investigations with their family has drawn them closer to their elders.
text:
DISD Donna High School
March 9 at 1:18 PM ¬∑

Donna High School's Mexican American Studies Club attended the annual National Association of Chicano Chicana Scholars Tejas Foco Conference held at South Texas College's Pecan Campus this past Friday and Saturday. The students were given the privilege of kicking off Friday morning's plenary with a presentation on the positive impact Ethnic Studies has on student achievement. The students also gave a presentation on the creation of the border and how it has evolved over time, as well as the realities of daily life on the border as opposed to today's rhetoric. The final group of students presented their oral histories in which they explained to the audience how conducting these investigations with their family has drawn them closer to their elders.

What a wonderful Read Across America week (March 2-6, 2020)! We had a little of everything. We had guest readers...parent readers...student readers. We had birthday cake for staff, Green eggs and ham breakfast for parents (and a chance to read to their child), and a Book Potluck Breakfast for our teachers. Of course, our awesome teachers provided students with Dr. Seuss activities in the classrooms. What a fun week!

shared_text:
DISD Truman Price Elementary
March 9 at 9:28 AM ¬∑

Truman Price held it's annual Career Day on February 28, 2020. Our guests represented various fields in the community. They provided information to our students such as job requirements, educational level needed, and what their job entails. The students enjoyed the experience and a grand time was had by all. We want to acknowledge Mrs. Martha Rodriguez, Price's Counselor, for coordinating this event for our students. We also want to thank Price's Principal, Mrs. Olga Cervantes and Mrs. Elsa Guzman, Curriculum Specialist, for providing opportunities for our campus to host events such as this for our students. A huge thanks goes to all our community representatives who took time from their busy schedules to visit our campus.

post_text:
The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department would like to congratulate 3-D Academy student, Max Rodriguez, for earning his Class A Commercial Driver's License. Max had previously earned his Class B CDL during the first semester of this school year. The Donna ISD community is very proud of Max as he is well on his way into a career where the demand is high. The CTE Department and the Donna ISD community would like to wish Max the best of luck in all his future career endeavors.

Donna ISD is proud to be the only school district in the State of Texas to be offering CDL training to its students. A big thank you goes out to Mr. Aldo Ortiz, RGV CDL owner, and Mr. Lupe Quintero, RGV CDL instructor, for their training and partnership with our district.

They will compete this Saturday, March 7, at PSJA Southwest beginning at 8 a.m. Pictured Back Row: L to R are Anahi Ochoa, 12th, Angelina Yanez, 9th, Melanie Gutierrez, 12th, Rosalinda Rodriguez, 10th, and Kristal Espinoza, 9th. Front Row: L to R are Jacqueline Sanchez, 12th, Roxanne Martinez, 12th, and Roxy Cantu, 10th. Not pictured is Nelly Gutierrez, 12th. We appreciate all the support given and we want to wish our Bravettes the Best of Luck on Saturday.

*They will qualify to STATE competition in Waco, March 22, 2020 if they meet their state totals or place top 12. Good luck and GO! FIGHT! WIN! BRAVETTES!!

shared_text:
DISD Donna High School
February 26 at 10:42 AM ¬∑

The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department is proud to announce that DHS student Daniel Vargas Jr, has become the first in Donna ISD history to earn his Class A (truck driving) Commercial Driver's License (CDL). Daniel previously earned his Class B (bus driving) CDL during the first semester of this school year. The demand for truck drivers is higher than ever, and having earned both the Class A and Class B CDL licenses, will definitely make Daniel more marketable in a career that opens up an abundance of new opportunities for him. CTE and the Donna ISD community are proud of Daniel Vargas Jr. and wish him well in his future career endeavours.

A big thank you goes out to Mr. Aldo Ortiz, RGV CDL owner, and Mr. Lupe Quinter, RGV CDL instructor, for partnering up with Donna ISD and providing these great career opportunities for our students.

shared_text:
DISD Donna North High School
February 24 at 1:26 PM ¬∑

The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department would like to congratulate all our DNHS Culinary Arts students who competed at the SkillsUSA District competition hosted by the TSTC campus in Harlingen. Our students went all out and represented DNHS and Donna ISD with pride and excellence. Special recognition goes out to DNHS students Emily Garcia, for placing 1st in Commercial Baking, and Dulce Perez for earning 2nd place honors in Commercial Baking. We would like to wish Emily and Dulce good luck as they move on to represent DNHS and Donna ISD at the SkillsUSA State competition, with a chance to advance to Nationals. We would also like to recognize Culinary Arts Quiz Bowl Bronze Medal winners, DNHS students Kassandra Castillo, Erick Ramirez and Robert Torres.

Congratulations also goes out to DNHS Culinary Arts instructor Chef Dagoberto Garza, for the training he provides on a daily basis and for providing these great learning opportunities for our students.

How can you help your kids with their homework?

‚úÖ Make sure your child has a quiet, well-lit place to complete their assignments.
‚úÖ Be positive about homework.
‚úÖ When your child asks for help, provide guidance ‚Äî not answers.
‚úÖ Stay informed and in communication with your child‚Äôs teacher on homework assignments.

Check out this resource for more insights: http://bit.ly/2Smf8Kz.

shared_text:
DISD W.A Todd Middle School
February 18 at 5:57 PM ¬∑

Our Todd MS students lined the halls for a special send off this afternoon for classmate Marcus Martinez. The 12-year-old will undergo surgery on both his legs at Texas Children's Hospital in Houston tomorrow. His grandmother Elena Reyes and mother Helen Martinez were in attendance as they witnessed the love and support from the students. This will be Marcus' 15th surgery but the family is hopeful this one will allow Marcus to walk on his own. Todd MS and Donna ISD wish him well and a full and speedy recovery.

The 12-year-old will undergo surgery on both his legs at Texas Children's Hospital in Houston tomorrow. This will be Marcus' 15th surgery but the family is hopeful this one will allow Marcus to walk on his own. Todd MS and Donna ISD wish him well and a full and speedy recovery.

shared_text:
DISD Donna North High School
February 18 at 5:13 PM ¬∑

The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department would like to send a shout out to DNHS student Anahi Banda for being recognized at the Health Occupations Students of America (HOSA) Area Leadership Conference in McAllen this past weekend.This makes Anahi the 1st student in DNHS history to qualify for state competition to be held April 1-3 in Galveston. She will be competing with the top 3 students from each area of Texas and will have an opportunity to represent Donna ISD at the HOSA International Leadership Conference this summer. Anahi will be competing in the Medical Law and Ethics competition and we wish her the best of luck. Congratulations also goes out to HOSA sponsor and DNHS Health Science Instructor, Ms. Cynthia Aldape LMSW, CCMA, CPhT, for providing these great learning opportunities for our students.

shared_text:
DISD Guzman Elementary
January 30 at 6:21 PM ¬∑

On Monday, January 27th, B.G. Guzman Elementary students in PK-3rd grade celebrated Career Day. Students had the opportunity to listen to and speak with a variety of presenters. Students were informed on the careers of these presenters and had the opportunity to also ask questions pertaining to the different aspects of these professions.

Our students were able to hear from and visit with a variety of presenters. Our special guests came from all different type of backgrounds, in respect to careers. We had speakers from City of Donna Fire Department, AEP Electric Company, City of Donna Police Department, DISD Police Department, Rodeo Dental, Mr. Francisco Rodriguez (Rodriguez Taxi Cab Service), Ms. Maricela Avalos (Painter/Sculptor), T-Mobile, and Hidalgo Constable's Office Pct. 3.

Career Day is a wonderful way for our students to experience and understand the importance of their education. Our goal is to show our students that with a strong education they can pursue the career of their choice.

post_text: A big THANK YOU to our media friends who showed up to interview our Veterans Middle School students Nathanael De Leon and Rey Vela, and their teacher Daniel Gonzalez. Together the three created a prosthetic hand for Nathanael who was born without a right hand. Thanks to their dedication and hard work, Nathanael is now able to do things he was not able to do before. Look out for their inspiring story across these media outlets.

DISD Donna North High School
January 21 at 12:59 PM ¬∑

We're proud to announce that both Donna North Robotic teams did exceptionally well in the Curie League Championship this past weekend. Both of their teams made it to the semi-finals, and one made it to the final championship match. Donna North TSTEM won three awards: Control Award, Final Alliance Award and the Think Award which advanced them to the FIRST Tech Challenge (FTC)- South Texas Regional Championship. Special shout outs go out to Ms. Anderson, Mr. Chintapalli, Nathen Neira (Indian Spirit) and Daniela Escobar (Indian Princess) for coming out and supporting our teams!

Advancing Team members:
Jesus Ramos, Joey Ramirez, Gus Pedraza, Heaven Pena, Elmer Ramirez, Giovanna Plasencia, Ariadna Garza, Nathan Rubio, Ernesto De La Cruz, Alexis Covarrubias, Harol Alonso, Esdras Cortez

post_text:
Congratulations to our 11 Donna ISD teams that competed in the FIRST RGV First Lego League this past Sat., January 11 in Weslaco. The competition was intense, but rewarding and fun too for all who attended!!

Participating teams included: Adame, Guzman, Salazar, Sauceda, Solis, Stainke, Todd, Veterans, LeNoir, Price, and Salinas.

Solis and Todd both placed in the top 6 teams and automatically moved on to the FIRST Lego League South Championship to be held Sat., March 7 in Harlingen. Fantastic work Solis and Todd!!!

Kudos to all our teams for showing the competitive heart of Donna ISD!!!!

post_text:
The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department proudly recognizes the following DHS and DNHS students working towards earning their Real Estate License before graduating high school this year. These students have been working hard all semester and have earned their Texas Principles of Real Estate I Certification, which takes them one step closer to becoming Licensed Real Estate agents. Donna ISD is the only district in the Rio Grande Valley, and one of less than a handful of districts from throughout the State of Texas, to offer the Real Estate course to high school students. The Donna ISD community is proud of the following students (left to right):

Paulina Diaz (DNHS)
Michael Garcia (DHS)
Joshua Aguilar (DHS)
Jalen Mata (DHS)
Raymon Cavazos (DHS)

A big thank you goes out to Mr. Robert Marcus Cruz, DHS Real Estate Instructor, for providing these great learning opportunities for our students.

DISD Donna High School
December 6, 2019 at 4:39 PM ¬∑

Congratulations to these DHS educators for being identified as outstanding educators and nominated for the 2020 H-E-B Excellence in Education Awards!

Reyna Chavez - Special Ed. Dept. Head
Francisco Faticati - ELA Dept. Head
Sergio Garza - Social Studies Dept. Head
Matias Rivera - Band Director
Mary Cantu - RN-Health Science Teacher
Dr. Nancy Castillo - Principal

This program is designed to recognize the accomplishments of outstanding public school educators, districts, early childhood facilities and school boards across the state of Texas. Since the program's inception in 2002, more than $11 million dollars has been awarded to deserving educators.

The nomination means our educators are eligible to win $5,000-$25,000 for themselves and a matching grant for our school.

post_text:
The Career Technical Education (CTE) Department would like to congratulate 3D Academy student Jerry Ybarra for becoming the 5th student in Donna ISD history to earn his Commercial Driver's License (Class B)This license opens up new doors to various employment and career opportunities across the country for Jerry as the demand for CDL drivers is at an all-time high. The 3D Academy and the entire Donna ISD community are very proud of Jerry and we wish him well in his future career endeavors.

A big thank you goes out to CDL instructor, Mr. Lupe Quintero for providing these great learning opportunities for our students. A big thank you also goes out to RGV CDL Services, and owner Mr. Aldo Ortiz for their partnership with Donna ISD and providing CDL training for our students.

DISD Guzman Elementary
November 22, 2019 at 5:33 PM ¬∑

November was designated "Citizenship" month at B. G. Guzman Elementary. Students put this character trait into practice by participating in a canned food drive. From November 5-19, students brought in a variety of canned goods and food items. With the continued support of our parents and participation of our students, B. G. Guzman was able to make a sizable donation to the Open Hands Food Pantry here in Donna. By selflessly helping those in need in their own community, our students truly exemplified the meaning of the word citizenship.

shared_text:
DISD Donna High School
November 11, 2019 at 1:01 PM ¬∑

On November 8th and 9th, Donna High School hosted over 300 students and choir directors from across the RGV for TMEA's Region 28 Clinic and Concert. Seven of our own DHS choir members were a part of this prestigious event. Mr. Thomas Jaber, Director of Choirs at Rice University directed the TMEA Mixed Choirs and Conductor and Author, Mrs. Denise Eaton directed the District Treble Choir. Students sang music in range from Brahms to Rachmaninoff to contemporary composers as young as 21 years old. Congratulations to our talented singers.
Region choir members:
Tabitha Martinez and Amber Diaz
District Choir members:
Katia Thigpen, Gwen Gonzalez, Danielle Ayala, Shelsea Betancourt and Anahi Ruiz

Veterans MS hosted a fantastic FIRST RGV First Tech Challenge (FTC) event for the 2nd consecutive year this past Saturday!! Kudos to Ms. Guerrero, Ms. Sauceda, Mr. Gonzalez, Mr. Chintapalli, and the rest of our hosts and volunteers who made this competition possible.

DHS, DNHS, DNHS T-STEM, and Veterans MS all competed in either the morning or the afternoon with 64 total matches taking place.

DNHS is currently in 3rd place and DNHS T-STEM is in 10th place out of 27 teams in the Curie League. Veterans MS, although this is their first year of competition, is a respectable 24th ahead of high school teams from Brownsville and Los Fresnos.

DHS is in 14th place, out of 24 teams in the Hawking‚Ä¶

DISD Guzman Elementary
November 5, 2019 at 11:19 AM ¬∑

On Friday, Nov. 1st, B. G. Guzman Elementary held its first Attendance Carnival. All students who had perfect attendance for the 2nd six weeks were treated to a "carnival style" day of fun. Students were given one ticket for each day they were present during the 2nd six weeks (24 total tickets). Students were able to spend these tickets on a variety of games and food items. A great time was had by all! B. G. Guzman Elementary will continue to encourage and promote the importance of daily attendance and the impact it has on their academic future.

DISD ACE Program
October 24, 2019 at 4:14 PM ¬∑

Sauceda M.S. ACE Program hosted a family engagement event on Breast Cancer Awareness and Superintendent Dr. Hafedh Azaiez visited us. National Breast Cancer Awareness in October is a chance to raise awareness about the importance of finding breast cancer early. It's about making a difference! It's about spreading the word about mammograms, and encourage communities, organizations, families, and individuals to get involved. Special thanks to Mrs. Cuellar, ACE Coordinator, and Mr. Ricardo Soria, Librarian at Sauceda, for collaborating in organizing this special event for our community! We appreciate Mrs. Hernandez, School Administrator, for her support.

post_text: Donna ISD Transportation Director Daniel Trevino was invited to say a few words at an Hidalgo County ribbon cutting road paving ceremony this morning. West Roosevelt Road is now accessible to our bus drivers transporting our students to and from their homes. As a former bus driver himself, Mr. Trevino‚Äôs message put into context the importance of this project and even caught the attention of local news stations. Thank you Hidalgo County for your support.

post_text:
DISD's Science Dept.'s annual NASA Family Night will be held at M. Rivas Elem. & J.W. Caceres Elem. on Tues., October 29. Awesome Donna ISD teachers will be facilitating multiple hands-on activities highlighting space-related STEAM concepts from 5:30 p.m - 7:00 p.m.

Our focus is 5th grade students. The school that has the highest % of 5th grade students in attendance will receive a prize of $100 in science materials.

Additionally, the elementary school that has the greatest % of classroom instructional staff volunteering will receive a prize of $100 in science materials.
